newsitem.title: LEBANON: Two Israeli soldiers injured in Lebanon guerrilla attack.
newsitem.headline: Two Israeli soldiers injured in Lebanon guerrilla attack.

text.p: Two Israeli soldiers were wounded on Sunday when Hizbollah guerrillas rocketed their outpost in south Lebanon, pro-Israeli militia sources said.

The soldiers were injured when guerrillas fired machineguns, rocket propelled grenades and shells into the outpost of Dabsheh in the eastern sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone, the sources said.
The two soldiers were taken to hospital in Israel.
In Beirut, the pro-Iranian Hizbollah claimed responsibility for the attack.
Hizbollah guerrillas fight Israeli troops in a bid to oust them from a buffer zone which the Jewish state carved out in 1985 to protect its northern borders against guerrilla attacks.
